channel.title: Formatting computer without uninstalling windows
channel.description:
Is there anyway I can format my dad's old HP laptop without getting rid of the windows os on there? (yes it's xp, it's about 5 years old laptop).
There's a lot of spyware and junk on it, generally causing problems on the laptop and I don't want to go through the pain of scanning and removing etc so I'd rather start afresh.

item.title: Formatting computer without uninstalling windows
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

Lothy:

No, there isn’t. You need to back up any important files to an external source (external hard disk, DVDs, etc), format, and then freshly install an operating system.

Miss Silabsoft:

For the love of god don’t forget your drivers, I told my sister how to format her computer and reinstall windows forgetting to tell her to make copies of drivers. she does it and ends up not being able to connect to the internet to get to the dell support website. I felt the wrath of hell and I’m half a world away from her.

alright thanks, i’ll just have to do it the long way

Read full topic

I’m just wondering if there is a function where my windows can be saved ?
